showme.pack.title: Linear Equations with Infinitely Many Solutions
showme.pack.caption: Linear Equations with Infinitely Many Solutions

statement.para: If a system of linear equations has more than one solution, it automatically has infinitely many such. This is so because the solution hyperplanes of its equations intersect in a line or a plane or in a higher dimensional space.

The RREF of a system of linear equations indicates that the system has infinitely many solutions as follows: there are
free variables
A variable is called free if it is not tied to a leading 1.
and the augmented part does not contain a leading 1.
Each column in the non-augmented part without a leading 1 corresponds to a variable whose number values can be chosen freely. So there are infinitely many solutions. Visibly,

(number of free variables) = (number of variables) -
rank(system)
The rank of a system of linear equations is the number of leading 1’s in the RREF of its coefficient matrix.
